page.title: 11Children's Play Area
page.content: Acres Open Space Children's Play Area. About 15 years ago there was no play area at all in Gnosall. Some children played on the road. About 10 years ago a property developer gave 26 acres to the Parish Council to be made into a play and recreation area. The Parish Council made a play area about 5 years ago and more recently an adventure playground. It took a lot of money to develop the play area. The slide cost 1000 pounds; the swings 800 pounds; the climbing frame 500 pounds; the seat 150 pounds and the litter bin 30 pounds. Mounds of surplus soil were put round the play area to keep out the wind. The Parish Council has cut the grass and planted trees to create a village green. Dogs must be kept on a lead. There is no cycling or playing with boats on the brook.
